titles.title: Congratulating the City of Chicago for being chosen to represent the United States in the international competition to host the 2016 Olympic and Paralympic Games, and encouraging the International Olympic Committee to select Chicago as the site of the 2016 Olympic and Paralympic Games.

Congratulating the City of Chicago for being chosen to represent the United States in the international competition to host the 2016 Olympic and Paralympic Games, and encouraging the International Olympic Committee to select Chicago as the site of the 2016 Olympic and Paralympic Games.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Mr. Sires moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 118.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

calendar.text: Received in the Senate. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 130.

action.text: Indefinitely postponed by Senate by Unanimous Consent.

bill.summary:
Congratulates Chicago on securing the bid to represent the United States in the international competition to host the 2016 Olympic and Paralympic Games.
Encourages the International Olympic Committee to select Chicago as the site of the Games.
